intro: Stenospermation hilligii, commonly known as the narrow-seed orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a unique type of seed capsule that is elongated and narrow, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
